solution_line_template: Rick has one less than three stripes, or {olga_stripes}-{rick_less_than_olga}={rick_stripes} stripes on each tennis shoe.

Hortense has double the {olga_stripes} stripes that Olga has, or a total of {olga_stripes}*{hortense_double_olga}=<<{olga_stripes}*{hortense_double_olga}={hortense_stripes}>>{hortense_stripes} stripes per shoe.

Since each of them has two tennis shoes per pair, then the total number of stripes on all of their shoes is {shoes_per_pair}*({olga_stripes}+{rick_stripes}+{hortense_stripes})=<<{shoes_per_pair}*({olga_stripes}+{rick_stripes}+{hortense_stripes})={total_stripes}>>{total_stripes} stripes
